meanings.definition: The source or origin of a spring.
meanings.sent1: The springheads in the mountains provide water for the river below.
meanings.sent2: We hiked to the springheads to see where the water comes from.
meanings.sent3: The animals gathered around the springheads, curious about the water source.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was the springheads of all the innovative ideas in the project.
meanings.sent5: The springheads bubbled with fresh, cool water, inviting us to drink.

meanings.definition: A person who heads or leads a spring.
meanings.sent1: The springheads guided the group to the hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent2: As the springheads of the team, she always knew the best routes to take.
meanings.sent3: The springheads organized a fun outing for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: He was the springheads of the expedition, leading us through the challenging terrain.
meanings.sent5: The springheads shared their knowledge of the forest with the curious hikers.

meanings.definition: The top or beginning of a spring.
meanings.sent1: The springheads of the stream were covered in colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: We sat by the springheads, enjoying the peaceful sound of flowing water.
meanings.sent3: The children played near the springheads, pretending it was a magical fountain.
meanings.sent4: At the springheads of the trail, we paused to admire the scenic view.
meanings.sent5: The springheads sparkled in the sunlight, a beautiful sight to behold.
